1. Title: Taken (2008) | Plot: Six friends come together to play "The Game" as a celebration of Nick's birthday. After a few rounds of they get separated while following a black van. Three stop in an alley so that Nick can relieve. His friends are forced into the lost black van by two druges. The other car of friends are informed by the kidnappers that if they want to see them again they have to do exactly what they say. It is revealed that the kidnappers are a modern day Jack the Ripper duo, stalking the streets, picking up prostitutes whom they murder and mutilate. These killer/kidnappers alarmed for being followed, frame these guys. It is the mission of the remaining friends to dispose of the body to retrieve their friends.

I would recommend The Blood of My Brother and Kingdom of Heaven. Both movies have a captivating storyline, talented actors, and stunning visuals that will keep you on the edge of your seat.
In The Blood of My Brother, the main character Ra'ad travels to Jerusalem during the Crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people. As he tries to protect his city from the invading forces, he must also face his own personal demons and try to overcome them.
In Kingdom of Heaven, the main character Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the Crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people. As he tries to protect his city from the invading forces, he must also face his own personal demons and try to overcome them.
Overall, both movies are worth watching and are sure to provide you with an exciting and memorable viewing experience.
